2019 – 2020 ValvTechnologies
Position: EMEA Industry Sales Manager
Reporting to the company Vice President as well as Global Director, managing the company business in Middle East, Africa, Europe, and Caspian region (EMEA).
Responsible for the business P&L for all the company product lines in EMEA.
Managing sales team and a network of distributors and agents across EMEA.
Develop business growth plans and forecast annual sales volumes.
Develop and manage the execution for market penetration or different location and countries in EMEA.
Manage all the business with all the region major customers such as ARAMCO, KNPC, Shell, BP, ADNOC, SABIC, Chevron, BP, Worley, KBR, McDermott, Fluor, ExxonMobil.
2018 – 2019 ITM Power
Position: Major Projects Manager
ITM is a leading manufacturing and technology company that produce various Green hydrogen production and storage units that been used in the renewable, power and oil and gas industries. The technology uses the power generated from the wind farms (and other renewable energy sources) to produce clean energy (Hydrogen).
Reporting to the company’s Executive Director, he was managing the company’s major projects, in different phases, and leading teams of 40 - 180 people depending on the project size.
Successful project delivery from concept design to commissioning, handover, and closure stages in accordance with safety, cost, scope, quality & time in line with the overall project schedule, meeting all business & technical requirements
Examples of Green Hydrogen projects that he was involved in:
Hydrogen Production facilities in UK: First of Its Kind (FOAK) technology / project, two electrolysers, 3MW.
Hydrogen Production facilities in UK: 1.5MW, one electrolyser.
Hydrogen Production facilities in France: 3MW, two electrolysers.
2015 – 2018 AspenTech
Position: Senior Regional Sales Manager
AspenTech is a Digital Transformation firm that has very wide of portfolio of IT and technology solutions and has the largest market share in the different areas such as, engineering (HYSYS & AspenPlus), manufacturing execution systems (MES), design, supply chain management (SCM), advanced process control (APC), scheduling, asset performance management (APM), big data, IoT, predictive maintenance analytics, maintenance optimization, machine learning and reliability.
Reporting the VP of Sales, he was responsible for number of global accounts (such as BP, ExxonMobil, BASF, DOW, Shell and SABIC) in Europe and Africa, while helping in any business issue related to them from the global prospective.
Prepared different sales strategy plans such as Account plans, Territory plans, Total Addressable Market (TAM), White Space etc.
Ensured global customers bought into the company’s Solutions’ Roadmap via understanding their business requirements.
Delivered large number of service projects to customers.
The contracts responsible for; are between $100K up to $60MM (in 5:6- year term contracts).
2011 – 2015 Honeywell UOP
Position: Regional Business Development Manager
UOP is the leading Consultancy and Technologies provider (Licensor) for the, downstream, petrochemical and Refineries.
Worked in UOP’s PT&E (Process Equipment and Technologies) division selling different technologies, catalysts, adsorbents as well as equipment. He was also responsible for our business as well as projects/studies delivery in EMEA region.
Examples of Technologies that he was responsible for: CCR Platforming, Hydrocracking, PDH (Oleflex), Methanol to Olefins (MTO), Penex, Para-Isom, FCC, Delayed Coking, Lube Oils, BOU (bottom of barrel upgrading technologies) and the relevant catalysts and adsorbents to each process.
Examples of projects / prospects / studies worked on includes:
60% expansion of existing 100,000 BPD complex refinery [revenue: over $100M].
New 350 KT/Y PDH (Olefins production) Plant feasibility study [revenue: over $250k].
New Naphtha Hydrotreating/ CCR Platforming/isomerization (gasoline production) Complex [revenue: over $70M].
New 200,000 BPD refinery Configuration Study [revenue: over $500k].
Gasoline/Naphtha productions complex modernization [revenue: over $300k].
2007 – 2011 WorleyParsons
Position: Lead Process Engineer
Managed a team of 12 engineers, including managing their performance, giving training, and setting their KPIs.
Performing all the project/process engineering work in variety of upstream (offshore and Onshore) and downstream (Refineries and Petrochemicals) projects.
Involved in both Greenfield as well as Brownfield projects.
Responsible for all the engineering work, including new equipment specifications (pumps, compressors, valves etc.)
Sizing and engineering all the new equipment including control valves, manual valves, compressor, vessels, pumps etc.
Liaising with the different equipment suppliers and vendors.
Worked on projects in Middle east, Africa, Canada, and Thailand
He was involved in the following projects:
Conceptual Study followed by FEED for an Unmanned Offshore Platform (WHP) project.
BP offshore complex Platforms rehabilitation brown field.
FEED and EPC Development for 90,000 BPD Complex Refinery.
Complex (Hydrocracking, Coker) Refinery PMC team
Grass root Onshore gas field development in Sudan.
Apache FEED/Detailed Engineering for debottlenecking of Gas Plant Debottlenecking.
De-bottlenecking Study for Onshore oil field development.
Conceptual Study for Heavy Oil Plant including production well heads, water treating facilities, steam injection wells and steam generation facilities.
FEED/Detailed engineering for 50 MMSCFD Gas Lift System Project.
Coker Complex Refinery Modernization and debottlenecking.
Green field complex offshore platform.
2010 – 2011 EBIC
Position: Process Engineering Specialist
EBIC/EFC are Ammonia and Urea/Fertilizers plants.
Responsible for the plant operation support, new facilities engineering, Projects delivery, performance management as well as training and coaching new engineers.
Plant troubleshooting and operation as well as new projects and liaising with all the equipment suppliers.
EBIC is an Ammonia Plant that was designed based on KBR KAAP technology.
2003 – 2007 MIDOR Refinery
Position: Senior Process Engineer
Process Engineer in 100,000 BPD Complex Refinery (MIDOR Refinery) including Hydrocracking delayed Coker, Platforming, SRU, ATU and hydrogen units.
Responsible for technical support for Hydrocracking Unit, CCR Platforming, Naphtha Hydrotreating (NHT), Naphtha Splitter Units (UOP Licensed Units) and Hydrogen Units.
Size all the new equipment including valves, pumps etc.
Plant troubleshooting and operation as well as new projects and liaising with all the equipment suppliers.
Coordinating all the turnarounds and supervise the maintenance activities and catalyst loading/unloading.
2001 – 2003 El Nasr for Fertilizers & Chemical Industries
Position: Process Engineer
Shift Operation Engineer in a Fertilizers Plant including Ammonia, Hydrogen, Ammonium Nitrate, Nitric acid and Sulfur units.
COMMENT
Master’s Degree in Chemical Engineering, as well as an MBA from University of Surrey, UK. 20 years of solid business management and sales experience in senior levels in different fields such as:
Ammonia, SynGas, Methanol and Fertilizers.
Green Ammonia, Green Methanol and Green Hydrogen.
Process Technologies licensing and catalysts.
Oil and gas; upstream, midstream refineries and downstream.
Chemical and Petrochemicals.
IT and digitization.
Worked for number of the world leading organizations such as Honeywell UOP (Technology licensor and Catalysts & Adsorbents manufacturer), WorleyParsons (EPC contractors), AspenTech (the Oil and Gas leading Technology vendor), ITM Power (The world leading Hydrogen and renewable energy company), well as number of the oil refineries and fertilizers/chemicals plants.
Within these years, he worked with investors, executives, industries leaders, CEOs, agents / distributors and governments across Europe, Russia, Middle East, and Africa, delivering different business, projects and investments plans.
